intro: Cacalia obtusifolia, commonly known as the bluntleaf cacalia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant features basal leaves that are broad and rounded, with a rough texture. Its flowering period typically occurs in late spring to early summer, producing small, white or pale yellow flowers. Cacalia obtusifolia is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to sunny, dry environments.
